poem:
"Unanticipated Victory's Cry"

After the prize, fear unfurls its petals,
red poppies in a Colombian dawn.
Justice dances yet her partner threatens,
a mocking seagull in London fog.
Taste the irony, bitter and cold,
20 minutes of transient glory.
Welcome to the dissonant symphony,
where courage sounds its discordant note.
Death hums in reply, yet life,
a tenacious weed, persists.
